question: What happens to the velocity of a light body when it undergoes an elastic collision in one dimension with a very heavy body at rest?
option2: it rebounds with twice of its own velocity
option3: it rebounds with its own velocity
option4: it stops and comes to rest
answer: it rebounds with its own velocity
explanation: A light body rebounds with its own velocity when it undergoes an elastic collision in one dimension with a very heavy body at rest. Note: The heavy body continues to be in rest in this case
